column2: PD Carepartner, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver)
column9: My husband was diagnosed with Parkinson's Disease (PD) at age 53 in 2003.  Mirapex was the first drug prescribed by his neurologist, in gradually increasing doses.  Over time, other drugs were added: Sinemet (levodopa/carbidopa), Stalevo (levodopa/carbidopa/entacapone), & Azilect and anti-anxiety drugs.  Soon, his Mirapex reached the maximum dosage (4.5 mg/day).During the first five years, my husband's PD seemed manageable; but compulsive behaviors emerged & worsened: he gave money to strangers, often lied to me, stayed up/out all night, got involved with troublesome people, spent money recklessly, posted personal info on dating web sites, etc. His doctor was very concerned that my husband took 2 - 4 EXTRA pills per day (Sinemet & Stalevo) for 36 months; but gave no guidance to help my husband take his pills correctly.In Dec. 2010, my husband was referred to a PD neurology sub-specialist, who at the first visit took him "cold turkey" OFF Mirapex & increased his Stalevo.  She gave specific times to take his medicines & had/has him keep a "PD Diary":  when he takes his medications; how he feels: "ON" (mobile with or w/out dyskinesias, those uncontrollable movements), "OFF" (not mobile); when asleep; etc.  After a transition off Mirapex ("internal" tremors, etc.), my husband now takes less PD medication, sleeps better, & most importantly, stopped the crazy compulsive behaviors that almost ruined our 30-year marriage & our 40-year relationship!  BE CAREFUL WHEN CHOOSING A NEUROLOGIST for PARKINSON'S DISEASE, JOIN A PD SUPPORT GROUP, & BEWARE Mirapex!  Our primary care doctor referred my husband to his first neurologist.  Our PD support group highly recommended the PD sub-specialist to me in November 2009; but my husband refused to see the sub-specialist until his first neurologist referred him to her!PD & PD medications affect patients differently.  I hope my harrowing tale can help spare other PD caregivers the hell that I endured over the past two years!
